author: Bert-Jan Lappenschaar
title: Trusted time-tracking and billing
description: Time tracking and billing of work is currently a messy and time-consuming process that often requires manual input and approval steps.

assessments.note: The proposal hits head on with a trust issue that every person that has had a time tracked job faces. Both parties face a level of mistrust that is currently mitigated by 'time cards' and 'pay stubs' which for many employers can take days, and the administration cost for these is significant. For my small business pay roll processing with ADP costs $100's of dollars a month, and isn't 100% trusted. This would simplify that process and build trusting using escrow - something that is currently too expensive on the admin side to pull off. I challenge the team to do shift by shift payouts. if proposal reduces payroll costs enough there's no reason to batch payments into a week or more.
Nice idea, especially the part about escrowing payments. provides more security to workers.

If users are going to be making a career on blockchain jobs then it makes sense to incorporate how they record time tracking as well on the blockchain. This app could help all developers in the ecosystem looking to earn wages. I will be following this idea as it goes forward.

The proposal plans to create a system to handle the time tracking/billing system for workers and organizations using the Cardano blockchain.
The main idea is to simplify this administration process introducing trust and transparency with the help of the blockchain and other related Cardano technologies (like DID). The mechanics of the system will include an escrow smart contract to handle automatic payments.
With all this elements the proposal clearly addresses the challenge because could create adoption by companies and organizations and consequently by workers that will be asked by the employers to use the system, thus bringing new users closer to the Cardano Ecosystem. Furthermore every single active use of the Dapp will create transactions to track the progress and to make payments. The presence of internal token it also reinforces the belief that this dapp can really generate a lot of traffic in various ways.

The proposed application might be a good fit and there are no similar blockchain-based application that I know of. I deduct one star because the  advantages of blockchain for stated use-case and the advantages to the end-user are still a little doubtful.

The proposal implements a popular use case and might help in the adoption of Cardano in a large environment. The proposal aims to build a working prototype in three months and a user trial with a hosting company. There are many technical challenges however the experimentation is worth the Cost involved.

Time tracking is a great Dapp use case, especially on an inexpensive block chain.  successful implementation could bring large scale adoption.  Its not entirely clear from the proposal funds will be stored and transacted in ADA itself but the assumption is that the project will participate in the ADA DeFi ecosystem.

The proposal appears to meet the challenge criteria and offers a valid use case scenario. Difficult to gauge the level of interest from the community at this stage although it may be a niche product that will grow engagement over time.

The project identifies an application that has the potential to drive adoption to the Cardano ecosystem in a substantial way. The superiority of having time-tracking data secure on the blockchain is easy to explain and visualise by people who are not crypto experts, thus if implemented it has the potential to drive adoption from within business circles that otherwise might not be exposed to the crypto technology.

This proposal is a great and complex implementation that improve many software module of the cardano foundation (like ATALA PRISM, cardano blockchain, cardano smart-contracts, etc…). The proposal clearly articulates how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem and for the stakeholders (in deep detail for users, companies,.. ). However the objective of the proposal is based on real idea that Is just implemented, so I think it's a god starting point.

This proposal meet fund 5 DApps and integration challenge. This solution will use the different layer built on Cardano such as identity on Atlas, Cardano blockchain, and payment.  I would recommend looking into Ada pay as a possible integration for payment.
The team has subject matter experts in time tracking and billing, only weak spot might be block chain

Team seem to have the experience to deliver. Would be nice to know more about how they intend to drive takeup. Also how are they going to manage the release of funds? Is this purely just the employer statinghte work is done. What if there is a dispute about quality? Have you thought about reputation tracking metrics (workers and employers). These could include speed and quality from the employees, promptness of release of payment and evaluation by employees of employers? Is this going to be a market place, or just software employers can use to hire contractors/employees?

The team here looks experienced in being able to accomplish the task. The presentation is a good resource in explaining what they are trying to accomplish. The only uncertainty I have at the moment is the timeframe they are looking at. I think key parts like atala prism will not be available for consumer use in the near future.

The proposer brings clear evidences of skills and experience (the Dapp is already published in Google Play Store and iOS store and works in a centralized way). However if would be really useful to add some technical details about the implementation (I found only a single reference to the Marlowe Framework in the slides), a detailed descriptions of the tokenomics and what we should expect as a final product (it will be a website or a mobile app? How it will interact with wallets and the blockchain?).
It would also a nice add to have a detailed costs breakdown: it is ok to indicate that the fund requested will cove the full time wok of one person for 3 months but it would be great to add how many times/funds are intended for each development stage.
Furthermore, the project is also based on the use of Atala which is not yet ready and available for the public. It would be very useful to present alternative strategies in case this technology continues to be out of use in the coming months.

the proposal is very well prepared. The referenced linkedin-profiles give good information on the expertise of the involved people. The fact that the unpaid leave is mentioned to provide enought time ressources tell me, that it was already checked that this possiblity can be utilized.

The lead proposer has founded Project Hours and all co proposers have substantial experience in the related field and in software development. The aim is modest and the proposal has considered all the asociciated risks in implementation.

The Team has shared their linkedin profiles, and are involved in realized non-blockchain integrated timekeeping projects and functional languages. Developers are based in Cardano-friendly Netherlands so I believe acquiring inital participants will be feasible. More refinement is clearly needed, but I believe the team can succeed in the initial prototype stages and seek more funding and expertise as they go along.  One question I have it the tax implications and how this may affect adoption by employers.

The team appears to have the skillset required to make the proposal likely of successful implementation. The query for me is the author appears to suggest that further refinement and verification is required from potential end users and there is no guarantee that the resources required will result in success. Perhaps a smaller budget with a focus on this research of this nature would be more appropriate at this stage.

The fact that the team already has a working product on the market, ProjectHours, instills confidence that the adaptation to Cardano can be done. The project is for an exploration phase that if then turned into an actual product plan could pay dividends to the Cardano community. I would have liked to see a broken down budget that more clearly justifies the amount, but given it's a relatively small sum, and an explanation is given, it should suffice for now.

The proposal team is completed skilled and have a good trade off  between business and technical knowledge, so in my opinion will able to make surely a good pilot . In relation to the possible success of the initiative, I think that tracking hours and more in general job orders functionalities are useful, so there are a lot of possibilities for the adoption by the companies. Further I think it's important to improve details about the process related to the issue related to the market or capital risk.
This proposal is highly feasible because the team seems to understand the problem and the proposed solution can be implemented successfully by this current team.

Project is complex but should be feasible for the team. They are obviously still working through all the details and a more complete plan with cost breakdown would help in estimating feasibility. Where location are they intending to launch in?

The notes on roadmap are great and appreciated. Seems like a decent enough idea but at the moment I'm of the belief that its too early for its time. Since a component of this is identity and cardano has the atala prism to accommodate that I think it would be best to wait until that is available until this application is pursued.
The proposal provides sufficient information to audit it's progress through milestones while recognizing that it doesn't know everything yet.

A generic roadmap for the whole project is presented, but it would be great to add a specific roadmap with milestones for the first stage (the one for which funds are requested). KPI are completely missing: it would be useful to add some hard numbers/goals to better evaluate the success of the project. For example: what are the technologies selected in the prototype? What are the features of the "basic smart contracts"? With the working prototype how many user will be involved for testing? How many transactions could we expect will be generated from the prototype?
All these kind of elements would be a nice add to the proposal and a good guide to evaluate its success.

The roadmap is stated and the stated milestones make sense. The time-frame of the months for a prototype is also reasonable. The requested funds are for validation and verification of the proposal and the creation of a prototype. What I miss is the cost-basis for the requested funds. Is there a hourly rate that was used to calculate the requested funds and could also potentially used for auditing?

Creating the application and configuration of the existing app to run over Cardano is explained in detail in the project. There are details that need to be gathered to arrive at the final design in this evolving proposal. However, the project will be monitorable and auditable.

This fund is for the first 3-month stage of the project which expects to produce a working prototype. Pilot projects will be part of future funding rounds.  The technical aspect of the project is not very detailed so it will be difficult to audit the progress.  Clearly some of these funds need to be spent gaining expertise in the appropriate blockchain integration.  in this sense 20k seems like a lot to produce a prototype. But if they are successful in producing it, we can be sure that they have learned a lot a long the way, and will be able to execute effectively the goals of future funding rounds.

Strong proposal supported by good information that does leave a window of questions still to be answered. An assessment of successful implementation is difficult without further understanding of the results from validation the author describes. I would have liked to have seen this aspect further developed or a slightly changed proposal where this was the focus of the funding requested. This would entail a research based proposal which clearly articulates the validation metrics being sought in order to promote the end product being proposed.

The progress on the proposed prototype app could be easily followed by the community and the deliverables verified. The included high level road map makes sense, and the time estimated for achieving an MVP seems reasonable. I would have liked to see an estimated start date for the project.

The proposer provides a step-by-step plan for the implementation with clear milestones and a defined time horizon. The only thing I miss in this area is that the proposer has not mentioned possible difficulties and how to deal with them.. The proposal offers a realistic timetable to complete the work. The proposer has considered well challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation for invoicing companies, so I think that they require to do a business plan
This project provided a roadmap that highlight the overall project which is good. I recommend developing a more detailed roadmap with key milestones.

solution: Project Hours will provide a global framework for time tracking and payments that will greatly improve trust between workers and companies
